data: 😌 Find the perfect frontend framework, based on what matters most for your project

Stack Match

😌 Find the perfect frontend framework, based on what matters most for your project.

🌐 Try out the app live, at: stack-match.as93.net
📊 Uses data from lissy93/framework-benchmarks

--- ### Developing #### Prerequisites You'll need Node.js installed, as well as Git and optionally Docker #### Setup Commands ``` git clone git@github.com:Lissy93/stack-match.git cd stack-match npm i npm run dev ``` --- ### Deploying #### Option 1 Follow the developing instructions above. Then run `npm run build` to compile output
You can then upload the contents of `./dist` to any web server, CDN or static host. #### Option 2 Fork the repo, and import into Vercel, Netlify or any static hosting provider of your choice. #### Option 3 Build the Docker image from the Dockerfile with `docker build -t stack-match .`
And then start the container, by running `docker run -p 8080:80 stack-match` --- ### Screenshot


A screenshot of the main app

--- ### Contributing Contributions are welcome.
Follow the Developing instructions above to get started, and then submit your changes as a PR.
If you're new to GitHub or open source, take a look at [git-in.to](https://git-in.to) for a guide on getting started. --- ### Attributions #### Sponsors ![sponsors badge](https://readme-contribs.as93.net/sponsors/lissy93?perRow=10) #### Contributors ![contributors badge](https://readme-contribs.as93.net/contributors/lissy93/stack-match?perRow=10) --- ### License > _**[lissy93/stack-match](https://github.com/lissy93/stack-match)** is licensed under [MIT](https://github.com/lissy93/stack-match/blob/HEAD/LICENSE) © [Alicia Sykes](https://aliciasykes.com) 2025._
